text: I have purchased this bike in 2024. Performance wise it is good. In Servicing of the bike, they will loot you. No cost savings if you are giving 3000 to 5000 for paid service after your one year service. This will be for every 6 months. So, whatever you are putting for petrol, you are giving it for servicing. Ather would be better if you are looking for cost saving 2 wheeler. If you want performance, and you could manage the high servicing cost, go for Ultraviolette f77.

author: @barryobrien1890

text:
Absolutely Love the take here on the Mach 2.
i had bought this Back in June 2024 and have been absolutely smitten by it.
its a Fast Commuter, Sporty design to give you a sense of it, a Big Bike that you can commit to, but has the range and presence on top.
The first month i enjoyed riding it thoroughly. usually clocking anywhere from 40-60km daily just to joyride.
the ballistic is truly a gem of a mode that gives you the trill and adrenaline that an ICE Motorcycle cant match at this price (0-40 is just out of the world)
After the month i had with it, i had to travel for work for 4 months, so no more riding for this.
every day i was stationed out i kept thinking about riding it again.

i watched this video back when it was released and after these opinions i have understood somethings about the bike that i didn't see at the time i bought it.
kudos to the Motorinc Team for putting it out so efficiently.
As Shumi has conveyed
Ballistic - Enjoyable
Powertrain - Amazing
Range Anxiety - What Anxiety? 
Riding Position - Committed, May not be the best
Chassis - Needs a lot of work
Throttle and Calibration - Almost Perfect
Modes - Effective enough
Heavy - Very
Precise - General

Its in no way comprehensive view on my experience with the bike. but generally agree with the points made in this video.

in the days i came back to ride the motorcycle again, I, Once again, loved it to bits.
With the pointers in the video in my mind i do notice that it is the way the motorcycle is made. but it is still really enjoyable.
I am out of the honeymoon phase after the initial ownership, but honestly its just as good of an experience owning it now as it was before when i didn't think about it flaws much.
i think i may love it more with its flaws now that there is room for improvement.

there are some points which i would like to make regarding what i have issues with
Headlamps - Not very good. it is not bright enough, and the throw of the high beam is too concentrated. a Aux lamp is highly recommended for highway use (Mounting is a problem, Most of the bike is covered in plastic - even the forks)
UI - as Shumi had covered, the UI feels very cluttered, the font is too small for the odo and trip. the screen is too small and really feels like it cheapens the bike for the price point its at.
Maps - the motorcycle has maps for navigation, but only mapples. which is great in city like Bangalore. but i have seen zero use in my place. i have been able to use it once, in all my time. other times it doesn't load, or frequently loose my location. i have resorted to just having my phone mounted and use maps there.

One thing i am quite impressed with is the communication and feedback procedure.
Partly due to there being less of them on road than something like a Bajaj or TVS.
Every time i had any issues, the technical manager has made it a point to let me know what is going on and how they are tackling it.
i had an issue where the software update failed during a door step service. which had to fixed by taking the motorcycle to the "Hanger" to be fixed. the RSA Was arranged, the bike was fixed and i got my Mach 2 in a Day. during the time there was the technician standby to get the motorcycle to me when it arrives. all this at no extra penalty (Which is obvious, but it didn't even occur as something i had to negotiate - Which cant be said about other 2 bikes which i own) 
(the second service cost, without oil change was around Rs 1450 - 1k of which was the doorstep service charges)
All in all, Just Really happy with the motorcycle and i can see myself enjoying the thrill of ballistic for a lot longer than i had expected.
Once again Kudos to Motorinc for this comprehensive first impressions, its really valuable, even for owners. as it allows to see deeper than what we may know.

It was enlightening sessions, the conclusion I got is.
Electric sports motorcycle is nonsense as there are too many sacrifices to make and it's pretty expensive. Better use electric scooter.
And for 3.99 lakhs for F77 is a hard sell when there's Aprilia RS 457 which is similarly priced. Looking at F77 alone as if nothing else exists for similarly priced, it still seems to expensive. text:
I live in Chennai. I was out shopping and it seems another ultraviolet F77 is in works. I saw the test bike. It was completely covered but just seeing the headlights and design, you could find out it was an ultraviolet. The roads are not good at that place, the road is made of potholes. The working of the suspension in that bike was so good to see. The person who was testing it was in full gear and was taking the bike intentionally on the worser parts of the bad road. It just seemed interesting to me. I wanted to share this with you all.

Happy riding.

author: @Satadru74x9

text:
As a f77 rider what was mentioned about the bike are facts. 
1. Power train/motor Performance is next to lag free unless you drive like a maniac.
2. The weight is an issue, atleast for a person who is more than 90kg, as the whole weight tends to fall on wrist & palms. Also because of the weight, the bike suddenly jerks forward even after hard braking, happened with me often. ( complained to UV waiting for reply since 6 months). And if there‚Äôs a pillion expect pain in wrists and palms for an hour once you get down the bike.
3. The parts which might give you trouble is chain & sprocket rattles a-lot once used for 10k kms and still left with some life, sometimes screen freezes, if its Mach 1 then tail fender which will loosen overtime, depending upon where you live switches/buttons on bike turns hard to press which will be irritating neither service centre guys will be able to do anything about this issue, the plastic flap is so flimsy that it will lift during pressure wash and then the water gets into charging socket and as the service team is relatively new so now and then they forget to tighten the bolts so please be aware.
4. The headlight feels inadequate and stressful on an highway, auxiliary lights from the company would be really helpful.
5. DC charging network and facility 

Good bits: Aesthetically good looking in few angles, performance, hydro phobic screen, less maintenance in long run, prompt response from team, works flawlessly even in knee deep water, provided with good charging network and less charging times this could be a great tourer too

text: It would be flying off the shelfs in Europe and US if you could pass safety standards and sell it at a similar price...

I do agree to some extent.... But... A vast number of people also eat exclusivity of owning a bike which is obviously not so common and thus has bragging rights. There are many people out there who just go for short weekend rides and their daily office commute but want to do that in style feeling special. I think this is perfect for those guys. Now that the Mach 2 is out and is almost a lakh cheaper 2.99 and 3.99 respectively, it brings it a lot closer to its ICE rivals. You guys definitely need to do a review of that or a Good podcast! üòÑüòÑüòÑ

text: i think this bike is for the global market
author: @tejusjose1006

text: See my other comments regarding this bike, I am in Australia and I am still waiting for this to hit Australian shores, Its now January 2024 and still nothing. This bike needs to sell for between 12 and 15K australian dollars to hit the sweet spot. If I were to go over to india and buy it in Australian dollars it would cost me just short of 10K uad for the top spec model, to bring it over to australia it would cost me another 1500 aud. Thats at most 11,500 aud. Add our famous taxes and import charges another 2,000 aud or less. But as a stand alone buyer this would be the MAX, for a motor vehicle company I am sure they would get them here vastly cheaper than I could alone. So again, top spec model 12K aud would be a hit. There are only 2 actual motorcycle looking EV in the australia market currently, that are a entry level budget motorcycle, super socco and Braaap. One is a cafe racer style and the other looks like a sports bike, both have a range upto 120 to 140km and tops speed of between 105 and 125km and take between 3 and 4 hrs to charge. The next level is 25K approx then the next level after that is between 35 and 60K out of the market except perhaps for extreme enthusiasts with deep pockets as they only do 20 to 50km more top speed, double the range and 1/2 the charge time

text: At this juncture, considering the underdeveloped charging network in India, I will not even consider buying a 5L electric bike. Moreover considering the charging time it's a deal breaker for me. On the flip side, I would definitely consider when the ultraviolette will adopts the new XFC Li-ion battery technology that charges 0-100 in under 30 min, and hope by that time the charging network will improve significantly.
